SEARCH
Package battleship.model

Class BattleshipModel

java.lang.Object
battleship.model.BattleshipModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BattleshipModel extends Object implements Serializable
The BattleshipModel class represents the game model for Battleship. It manages the game grids, fleets, ship placement, firing actions, and game state checks.
See Also:

    • BattleshipModel

      public BattleshipModel(LocalizationLoader loader)
      Constructor for BattleshipModel. Initializes player and opponent grids and fleets.
      Parameters:

    • canPlaceShip

      public boolean canPlaceShip(int[][] grid, int row, int col, int length, boolean horizontal)
      Checks if a ship can be placed at the specified position on the grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to check.
      row - The starting row index.
      col - The starting column index.
      length - The length of the ship.
      horizontal - Flag indicating if the ship is placed horizontally or vertically.
      Returns:
      true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.

    • isFleetSunk

      public boolean isFleetSunk(List<ShipModel> fleet)
      Checks if all ships in a fleet are sunk.
      Parameters:
      fleet - The fleet to check.
      Returns:
      true if all ships in the fleet are sunk, false otherwise.

    • playerWon

      public boolean playerWon()
      Checks if the player won the game.
      Returns:
      true if the opponent's fleet is sunk, false otherwise.

    • opponentWon

      public boolean opponentWon()
      Checks if the opponent won the game.
      Returns:
      true if the player's fleet is sunk, false otherwise.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if either player's or opponent's fleet is sunk, false otherwise.

    • checkGameOver

      public void checkGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over and displays the result.

    • placeShip

      public void placeShip(int[][] grid, ShipModel ship, int row, int col, boolean horizontal)
      Places a ship on the grid at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to place the ship on.
      ship - The ship to place.
      row - The starting row index.
      col - The starting column index.
      horizontal - Flag indicating if the ship is placed horizontally or vertically.

    • placeOpponentShipsRandomly

      public void placeOpponentShipsRandomly()
      Randomly places opponent's ships on the grid.

    • placeOpponentShips

      public void placeOpponentShips(int row, int col, int length, boolean isHorizontal)
      Places the opponent's ships on the grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The starting row for placing the ship.
      col - The starting column for placing the ship.
      length - The length of the ship to be placed.
      isHorizontal - True if the ship is to be placed horizontally, false if vertically.

    • playerFire

      public int playerFire(int row, int col)
      Processes player's fire action on opponent's grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the target cell.
      col - The column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      HIT if the target cell contains an opponent's ship, MISS if it's empty or already fired upon, -1 if the move is invalid.

    • playerFires

      public void playerFires(int row, int col)
      Initiates player's firing action at specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the grid cell.
      col - The column index of the grid cell.

    • opponentFire

      public int opponentFire(int row, int col)
      Processes opponent's fire action on player's grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the target cell.
      col - The column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      HIT if the target cell contains a player's ship, MISS if it's empty or already fired upon, -1 if the move is invalid.

    • opponentFires

      public void opponentFires(int row, int col)
      Initiates opponent's firing action randomly.
      Parameters:
      row - The grid row.
      col - The grid column.

    • resetModel

      public void resetModel()
      Resets the game model by initializing new grids and fleets for both the player and opponent. Clears existing grids and fleets and initializes them with default values.
